Notes: The 'row_id' serves as a technical identifier for each row in the CSV and is not modeled in the ontology paths provided. Typically, this can be mapped to a local identifier or used to generate the URI for each Measurement instance.
The patient_id matches the concept of a Patient entity linked from a Measurement. No 2-hop path from Patient is provided, so this is the optimal mapping.

measurement_code represents a code describing the measurement, which aligns directly with 'hasCode' to Code. No 2-hop paths from Code are provided here. The alternative (path 5) is to Terminology, but this field contains actual codes, not terminology metadata.

measurement_value is a numeric value and best fits as a Quantity. While Quantity may itself have a value and unit, no 2-hop path from Quantity is available in the provided options, thus direct mapping to hasQuantity is optimal.

measurement_unit is semantically part of the Quantity concept. While ideally this would be a property of Quantity (e.g., Quantity.unit), no 2-hop path to a unit is available, so it should be included as part of the same Quantity node as measurement_value.

measurement_date is the date/time when the measurement was taken. hasMeasurementDateTime (path 20) is more precise than hasDateTime (path 18), as it specifically refers to the measurement event. No 2-hop path is available from dateTime.
